gurmukhi: j`h q`h bFw pwp kw krm ]jg qy Gtw Drm kw Brm ]119]
transliteration: Jabh Tabh Badhaa Paap Kaa Karam|| Jag Te Ghataa Dharam Kaa Bharam||119||
translation: The sinful acts increased here and there and the religious karmas ended in the world.119.

gurmukhi: pwp pRcur j`h q`h jg BieE ]pMKn Dwr Drm auf gieE ]120]
transliteration: Paap Prachur Jahh Tahh Hag Bhaio|| Paaakhannddhaar Dharam Ud Gado||120||
translation: The sin increased to a large extent in the world and the dharma took wings and flew away.120.

gurmukhi: neI neI hon lgI inq bwq ]j`h q`h bwF cilE auqpwq ]121]
transliteration: Nainaihon Lage Nit Baat|| Jahh Tahh Baadh Chadio Outpaat||121||
translation: New things began to happen always and there were misfortunes here and there.121.

gurmukhi: sB jg clq AOr hI krm ]j`h q`h Gt gieE Drw qy Drm ]122]
transliteration: Sabh Jag Chalat Aur Hi Karam|| Jahh Tahh Ghat Gado Dharaa Te Dharam||122||
translation: The whole world began to perform the contrary karmas and the universal religion ended from the world.122.

gurmukhi: j`h q`h dyKIAq ]q`h q`h pyKIAq ]skl kukrmI ]khUM n DrmI ]123]
transliteration: Jahh Tahh Dekheeat|| Tahh Tahh Pekheeat|| Sakal Koukarmee|| Kahoon Na Dharmee||123||
translation: Wherever you see, there are only people committing wicked deeds and no one who accepts religion is seen.123.

gurmukhi: j`h q`h gunIAq ]q`h q`h sunIAq ]sB jg pwpI ]khUM n jwpI ]124]
transliteration: Jahh Tahh Gouneeat|| Tahh Tahh Souneeat|| Sabh Jag Paapi|| Kahoon Na Jaapi||124||
translation: Upto the limit where we can see and listen, the whole world appears as sinner.124.

gurmukhi: skl kukrmM ]Bj gieE DrmM ]j`g n sunIAq ]hom n gunIAq ]125]
transliteration: Sakal Koukaramannd|| Bhaj Gado Dharamannd|| Jagg Na Souneeat|| Hom Na Gouneeat||125||
translation: Because of vicious karmas, the dharma has fled away and no one talks about the Havana and yajna.125.

gurmukhi: skl kukrmI ]jgu BieE ADrmI ]khUM n pUjw ]bs rhXo dUjw ]126]
transliteration: Sakal Koukarmee|| Jag(u) Bhaio Adharmee|| Kahoon Na Poojaa|| Bas Rahyo Doojaa||126||
translation: All have become wicked and unrighteous; there is no meditation anywhere and only the duality resides in their minds.126.

gurmukhi: khUM n pUjw khUM n Arcw ]khUM n sRq Duin isMmRq n crcw ]khUM n homM khUM n dwnM ]khUM n sMjm khUM n SnwnM ]127]
transliteration: Kahoon Na Poojaa Kahoon Na Archaa|| Kahoon Na Srout Dhoun(i) Sinmrat Na Charchaa|| Kahoon Na Homan Kahoon Na Daanan|| Kahoon Na Sanjam Kahoon Na Shanaanan||127||
translation: There is no worship and offerings anywhere; there is no discussion about Vedas and Smritis anywhere; there is no hom and charity anywhere and nowhere the restraint and bath are seen.127.

gurmukhi: khUM n crcw khUM n bydM ]khUM invws n khUM kqybM ]khUM n qsbI khUM n mwlw ]khUM n homM khUM n j√çwlw ]128]
transliteration: Kahoon Na Charchaa Kahoon Ba Bedan|| Kahoon Nivaaj Na Kahoon Kateban|| Kahoon Na Tasbikahoon Na Maalaa|| Kahoon Na Homan Kahoon Na Juaalaa||128||
translation: No discussion about Vedas, no prayer no Semitic scriptures, no rosary and no sacrificial fire are seen anywhere.128.

gurmukhi: Aaur hI krmM Aaur hI DrmM ]Aaur hI BwvM Aaur hI mrmM ]Aaur hI rIqM Aaur hI crcw ]Aaur hI gIqM Aaur hI Arcw ]129]
transliteration: Aur Hikaramannd Aur Hidharamannd|| Aur Hibhaavan Aur Himaramannd|| Aur Hireetan Aur Hicharchaa|| Aur Higeetan Aur Hiarchaa||129||
translation: The contrary religious actions, feelings, secrets, rites, customs, discussion, worship and offerings are only visible.129.
